content:
journey: Phone Swap Request Feature
  title: Streamlined Device Swap Workflow
  sections:
    - title: Background
      nodes:
        - "Users lack formal way to request phone swap"
        - "New feature aims to create streamlined workflow"

    - title: User Story
      nodes:
        - "As a user, I want to request a phone from the available list and offer one of my current phones in exchange, so I can easily manage my device swaps."

    - title: Implementation Details
      nodes:
        - "Frontend (UI/UX): Add 'Request Phone Swap' button to main phone page"
        - "Clicking button triggers modal pop-up with form"
        - "Form includes fields for Phone to Request, Phone to Exchange, and Reason for Request (optional)"
        - "Actions: Submit Request and Cancel buttons"

    - title: Backend Logic
      nodes:
        - "Create new API endpoint (POST /api/phone-swaps) to handle form submissions"
        - "Create new table in database to store swap requests"
        - "Table includes columns for requester's ID, requested phone, offered phone, status (defaulting to 'Pending'), and comment"

    - title: Validation
      nodes:
        - "Backend validation ensures user making request is actual owner of phone being offered in exchange"

    - title: Action Items
      nodes:
        - "UX Team: Create wireframe of modal and form by EOD, October 17"
        - "Backend Team: Develop new API endpoint and database schema. Target completion: October 21"
        - "Frontend Team: Build 'Request Phone Swap' button and basic modal structure. Begin implementation once wireframes are approved"
        - "Product Manager: Create formal Jira ticket with defined user story and acceptance criteria"

    - title: Confirmation
      nodes:
        - "Upon successful submission, modal closes and confirmation message is displayed"

metadata.meeting_notes:
Phone Swap Request Feature
Date: October 14, 2025
Attendees: Product Manager, UX Designer, Lead Frontend Developer, Lead Backend Developer
Objective: Define the requirements and implementation plan fo

This Mermaid Journey map outlines the key steps involved in implementing the Phone Swap Request Feature. It covers the background context, user story, implementation details, backend logic, validation, action items, and confirmation of the feature.
